thread.title: Olympian Oscar Pistorius Released from Prison a Day Early
thread.title_full: Olympian Oscar Pistorius Released from Prison a Day Early

author: Kelly Terez
title: Olympian Oscar Pistorius Released from Prison a Day Early
text:
Share Article 
Herman Verwey/Foto24/Gallo Images/Getty Images (CAPE TOWN) -- Olympic sprinter Oscar Pistorius has been released from prison early. 
Pistorius spent 364 days behind bars for the killing of his girlfriend, Reeva Steenkamp, who he shot through a bathroom door because he thought she was an intruder. 
The Olympian is now staying at his uncle's home according to reports, and he will begin his 4 years of house arrest in Waterkloof, Pretoria. 
Pistorius was released a day early from the Kgosi Mampuru II Correctional Centre and "local management" of the prison has "confirmed that Oscar Pistorius was placed under correctional supervision to night." 
"The handling of the actual placement is an operational matter of the local management, and how they handle it is their prerogative," said a statement from the Department of Correctional Services spokesman Manelisi Wolela. "They carry it out in the best interest of all parties concerned, the victims, the offender and the Department of Correctional Services.‚Äù 
Prosecutors who believed the Olympian should've had a harsher sentence have appealed Pistorius' decision, and the case will be heard in a few weeks. 
Copyright   statement from the Department of Correctional Services spokesman Manelisi Wolela Tuesday, October 20, 2015 at 6:16AM
